It could: if you've ever noticed the tap sound when starting or stopping a =
recording session, assuming it is not being caused by pushing a switch in t=
he mic, the tap or pop you hear can be caused by the electronics as it begi=
ns to ceases recording.

Also a static charge can cause the pop.

e, 5/26/09, April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:

noise?

      Yes.=A0 Also faulty wiring, which is even more=
 
        dangerous.
Also with flakey transformers or other power distribut=
ion 
        in the area, or power lines.
Perhaps you can check with some 
=
        neighbors, and see how their power is doing.

          =A0
          During th=
e case that I recorded 
          those possible EVP's-there was a loud tap=
ping noise that seemed to 
          come from the 2nd bedroom. Upon checki=
ng my logs, every time one 
          of=A0 these clicks were heard, there =
would be an EMF spike in the 
          livingroom. The 2nd bedroom is upst=
airs, the livingroom downstairs. 
          The home owners have also repor=
ted that they have a touch lamp that 
          comes on all the time by it=
self and the lights in the Kitchen will dim 
          occasionally.
      =
    =A0
          Now these taps are not consistent 
          in timing, l=
oudness or rhythm. Could this be the work of faulty 
          breakers?
